issue.title: Replace usage of withConsecutive in phpunit tests

repository.name: Submitty
repository.description: Homework Submission, Automated Grading, and TA grading system.

issue.body:
In the [9.6.0](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/9c1d35553417e1ea333ce278885d3f853bc4efdb/ChangeLog-9.6.md?plain=1#L24) release of phpunit, it had:

> https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5063: Deprecate withConsecutive()

Where this function will be removed in phpunit 10. We use this in a number of places in Submitty, so we'll want to replace it in whatever is the recommended way for phpunit 9.6+.

issue.title: PHPUnit 9.6 misses deprecation warning for `withConsecutive()` removed in PHPUnit 10
issue.body:
| Q                   | A
| --------------------| ---------------
| PHPUnit version     | 9.6.3
| PHP version         | 8.1, 8.2
| Installation Method | Composer

#### Summary

We read about the changes in PHPUnit 10 and the removal of `withConsecutive()` + its alternatives (https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4564 and https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/4026), so starting with a  smooth upgrade path for our projects by upgrading to PHPUnit 9.6 first seemed like a logical step. We expected to see deprecation warnings for `withConsecutive()`, as they have been deprecated in https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/5063. After running the test suite with 9.6.3, there was no output to inform us about any deprecation, so it seems to me that there are no warnings for this method implemented yet, but I think there should be.

I'm interested in your thoughts on this. 

Btw, thanks for all the work you put into PHPUnit  :+1:

issue.title: THRIFT-5757 Unit tests for php lib
issue.body:
After running PHP unit tests for each pull request [THRIFT-5756](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-5756)

Next step is writing test for php lib.

It will be several pull request for this task.
  
- [X] Did you create an [Apache Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/THRIFT/issues/) ticket? [ ([Request account here](https://selfserve.apache.org/jira-account.html), not required for trivial changes)](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/THRIFT-5757)
- [X] If a ticket exists: Does your pull request title follow the pattern "THRIFT-NNNN: describe my issue"?
- [X] Did you squash your changes to a single commit?  (not required, but preferred)
- [X] Did you do your best to avoid breaking changes?  If one was needed, did you label the Jira ticket with "Breaking-Change"?
- [ ] If your change does not involve any code, include `[skip ci]` anywhere in the commit message to free up build resources.

issue.title: [PHPUnit 10] Add ifs as default way for withConsecutive, as more readable and opens upgrade during PHPUnit 9

body:
There are around ~10 variations of how PHPUnit `withConsecutive()` can be upgraded. If there is a reference, followed by `willReturn*()` or by `willReturnOnConsecutive()` and more.

Instead of creating answer that fits only one specific quesition, I've put down an article that explains, how to upgrade all kind of combinations.

See:
https://tomasvotruba.com/blog/how-to-upgrade-deprecated-phpunit-with-consecutive

Hopefully you'll find it useful.

It includes PHP 7.* ready code (no `match`), that can be used in PHPUnit 9 (that requires 7.3+)
